text: Johnny Speight (2 June 1920 â€“ 5 July 1998) was an English television screenwriter who wrote many British sitcoms like Till Death Us Do Part and In Sickness and in Health. Speight also wrote some episodes of All in the Family. He wrote for people who had radio shows like Cyril Fletcher and Frankie Howard. He was born in Canning Town, London. Speight died from pancreatic cancer on 5 July 1998 at his home in Chorleywood, aged 78. == References == == Other websites == * Category:1920 births Category:1998 deaths Category:English screenwriters Category:English television writers Category:People from the London Borough of Newham Category:Cancer deaths in England Category:Deaths from pancreatic cancer
title: Johnny Speight
